direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You fucking well do, don't shake your head at me -- when you're alone at night, when the rage takes you and you think of what you'd do to revenge her, on those nights you put a face to your enemy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop the car -- LUTHER -- we're going all the way, Walter -- WALTER SULLIVAN -- it's too terrible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It sure is. Walter Sullivan.    A long, shaky moment, then -- WALTER SULLIVAN ... I know about Alan's reputation as a philanderer... but... he would never dream of betraying me... I gave him the Presidency. Luther and Walter as Luther turns a sharp corner and the WHEELS SCREAM -- LUTHER (pressing it) The press conference -- remember?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: he held you in his arms and said if only Christy hadn't gotten sick she would have been with you                     * in Barbados --                                        * (MORE) (CONTINUED) )B(   ABSOLUTE POWER - Rev. 5/16/96                        121. 334   CONTINUED:    (3)

direction.raw_text: how do you think he knew she was sick? You didn't tell anybody. But he heard it, all right. He heard it from her. That night. And I heard every word -- Walter. For a moment, no reaction. Then he sits back hard. The air's out of him. He just breathes quietly. Then -- WALTER SULLIVAN That's not real proof. Luther.   Handing something back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this? Sullivan takes it -- -- it's the letter opener. Sullivan leans back, shuts his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could have stolen this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I did steal it. But that isn't my blood and those aren't my prints. CLOSEUP ON SULLIVAN                                               * Eyes still shut -- -- and he's very old and you expect tears -- -- but he didn't get to be Walter Sullivan by crying -- -- HOLD ON Walter -- -- and this incredible shriek of rage explodes! -- Luther, suddenly stopping the car -- 335   EXT. WHITE HOUSE GATE - NIGHT                               335 -- and we're at the rear of the White House.                      *
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 336   INT. LIMO - NIGHT                                           336 Walter.   He sits in the back a moment. Then he gets out. 337   EXT. WHITE HOUSE GATE/EXT. LIMO - NIGHT                     337 Luther has gotten out too. They stand close to each other. They nod. Then Walter starts away.

direction.raw_text: I did love her, you know. And he walks away. A White House SECURITY GUARD as Walter approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is he working late? I haven't an appointment but I'd like to see him if I might.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't need an appointment, Mr. Sullivan. And as he waves him through -- Luther, standing there, watching the old man. Walter, a final turn back, a nod of the head. Luther.   He nods back, returns to the car, gets in -- -- and now we begin a BLIZZARD OF CUTS. 338   EXT. WASHINGTON STREET/INT. Luther enters, gets some coffee. The TV is SHOWING the PRESS CONFERENCE Richmond held. As we WATCH, Walter Sullivan moves down toward the President and they embrace. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: Luther stops making coffee, looks at the screen.

direction.raw_text: That's a question that will haunt me forever. Of course I tried to stop him -- (beat)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (holding the note now, his voice is, when he speaks, calm; to Burton)

dialogue.raw_text: (kneeling close, almost whispering into Collin's ear)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #1 (V.O.) Mister Sullivan, have you no idea why the President took his own life?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) (voice soft) I know he's been feeling the pressure of office more than ever lately. We've talked about it a great deal.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: #2 (V.O.) But why would he stab himself?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Alan was like a son to me... Luther smiles, takes his coffee, leaves the room as we -- CUT TO: 347B   INT. Seth sees him and they both move to the door and confer silently -- -- Seth indicates Kate. Luther crosses his fingers. Seth says something we can't make out. Luther nods.
